ingredients: 8 thick slices 2-day-old bread (better if slightly stale)
method: In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and cinnamon. Stir in the orange zest and/or triple sec if using. Whisk the mixture until well blended and pour into a shallow bowl, wide enough to place a slice of the bread you will be using.
Place each slice of bread into the milk-egg mixture, allowing the bread to soak in some of it.

Melt some butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Shake off the excess egg mixture from the bread and place the bread slices onto the skillet. Brown on one side, then flip and brown the other side.
serve: Serve the French toast hot with butter, maple syrup, and/or fresh berries.

method: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract. Mix until smooth.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on both sides and serve hot.
serve: Serve the pancakes warm with butter, maple syrup, and fresh fruit if desired.

method: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until soft.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Serve the sauce over the cooked spaghetti.
serve: Top with grated Parmesan cheese and serve hot.

ingredients: 1 large head of romaine lettuce, chopped
method: In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, croutons, and grated Parmesan cheese.
Add grilled chicken slices on top.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and toss until evenly coated.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
serve: Serve immediately with extra Parmesan cheese if desired.

method: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until soft.
Add diced carrot, bell pepper, and peas. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Push the vegetables to the side of the pan and pour in the beaten eggs. Scramble until fully cooked.
Add the cooked rice, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Stir-fry until everything is well combined and heated through.
Garnish with chopped green onions if desired.
serve: Serve hot as a main dish or side.

method: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Arrange mozzarella slices on top of the sauce.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and drizzle with olive oil.
serve: Season with salt and pepper before serving hot.

method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan.
In a large bowl, mix together the melted butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla.
Stir in cocoa powder, flour, salt, and baking powder until well combined.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
serve: Let cool before cutting into squares. Serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream if desired.

ingredients: 2 cups semisweet and/or milk chocolate chips
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour and baking soda. Set aside.
In a separate bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add salt, vanilla, and eggs. Mix until combined.
Gradually add the flour mixture, then stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop dough by rounded tablespoons onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake until golden, about 10-12 minutes.
serve: Let cool on wire racks and enjoy warm or store in an airtight container.

method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Butter a 4x8 inch loaf pan.
In a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas with a fork. Stir in the melted butter.
Mix in the baking soda, salt, sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla extract. Add the flour last and mix until just combined.
Pour the batter into the loaf pan. Bake for 60-65 minutes or until a tester comes out clean.
serve: Let cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Slice and serve.

method: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until onion is translucent.
Add chicken cubes and cook until browned.
Stir in curry powder and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add coconut milk and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes.
serve: Serve hot with rice and garnish with fresh cilantro.
